snippet: Net income for United States farmers is expected to fall nearly 32 percent this year because of low crop prices and increasing expenses.
abstract: Agriculture Department releases report estimating that net income for United States farmers will be $73.6 billion in 2015, down nearly 32 percent from $108 billion in 2014; would mark second consecutive year of declining income.
lead_paragraph: Net income for United States farmers is expected to fall nearly 32 percent this year because of low crop prices and increasing expenses.

headline.print_headline: Farmers’ Profit Is Expected to Decline 32% in 2015
headline.main: Farmers’ Profit Is Expected to Decline 32% in 2015
